reviews.review_msg: I found that he sometimes did not know some of his slides properly which made it really hard to understand what he was saying. On top of that the exams were super complex because he wanted you to be super detailed on 50 min midterm exams.

Expects you to regurgitate the entire course onto the midterm in large essay style paragraphs. 45% class average on MT2 and he told the class he was disappointed and we should just try harder lol. Said that we needed to be able to describe the material at length but his lectures are power point diagrams with sparse notes. The dichotomy!

Thomas Claydon doesn't care about his students at all.  You need to remember every word on every lecture slide or you won't do well on the exams. The second midterm had a failing grade and he blamed the class for the poor grade instead of reflecting on his poor teaching ability and unfair exams. would highly recommend choosing another professor.
This is the worst professor ever. He does not care about students nor about their learning. Please do not take this class if you want to remain sane.

This was a very hard course for me. If you have ADHD good luck, lecture slides make no sense if you do not obtain every detail that he says in lecture, so get ready to type, you will miss things. The worst part of the class is the grading scheme. If you do not write 4 essays with the exact words as the answers you do bad. Midterm 2 avg = a fail!

I give Tom a 5 due to his ability to explain difficult concepts well and his willingness to help outside of class. However, you must take notes or record lectures due to his bare bones lecture slides. His choice of a TA is poor; the decision of cutting down the time on the final with no notice was unfair. He made sure the average was B regardless.

Don't listen to bots saying "he genuinely wants his students to succeed" - the average for midterm 2 was 56% and the final 50%. He was genuinely indifferent to peoples struggles during covid; refused to record lectures during a *pandemic* and didn't tell us the format for the final until literally the time of the final. + no textbook & bad slides.

Tom is a really good prof. He is very good at explaining the concepts. However, his lecture sides are not very detailed so if you miss a couple of classes chances are you will be completely clueless. His exams are essay style and each question is worth a lot of marks. So you have to know the material well to do well in a limited amount of time.

Tom is a really good prof. If you're gonna take 305 I would defs take it with him vs any other prof. The material isn't easy but he tells you exactly what you need to know. The exams are fair and fairly predictable.

Tom was an AMAZING prof! You knew exactly what you would be tested on and the midterms and final should have been a breeze if you put the time and effort into the class. Hands-down best prof I've had at SFU.

Amazing prof. Great at explaining concepts and will go out of his way to find answers to your questions. Exams consist of essay questions only. The questions on midterm 1, 3, and the final were somewhat predictable, but midterm 2 has random questions that no one was expecting. Overall fair exams and marking.

Firstly, Nick is easy on the eyes and very conversational. He made those tutorials easy to understand and helped you prepare for the exam. Great communicator and gives good examples. What more can you ask for!
